title: About Me
text: I am a PhD/Masters candidate in Organisational Psychology at Macquarie University, where I also work as a Sessional Academic. My research aims to understand why some teams thrive when under pressure, and others struggle to survive. In doing so, I specifically investigate team member interpersonal emotion regulation behaviour; perceptions of team identification, psychological safety, and trust; and test resilience-enhanced debriefing protocols.

title: Seth Coetzee
text:
Welcome to my academic website. I‚Äôm passionate about understanding what makes teams resilient when they face pressure and adversity.
Through my research and teaching, I explore the complex dynamics that help some teams thrive while others struggle - and how organizations can build more resilient, effective teams.

This site showcases my research in organizational psychology and team dynamics. Feel free to explore my publications, learn more about my background, or read my thoughts on research and practice.
This website is currently a work in progress ‚Ä¶ please be patient! It has been made using Quarto and GitHub Pages.

title: About Me
text: I am a PhD/Masters candidate in Organisational Psychology at Macquarie University, where I also work as a Sessional Academic. My research aims to understand why some teams thrive when under pressure, and others struggle to survive. In doing so, I specifically investigate team member interpersonal emotion regulation behaviour; perceptions of team identification, psychological safety, and trust; and test resilience-enhanced debriefing protocols.

title: About Me
text:
Research Interests

Team resilience and systemic interventions
Organizational wellbeing and stress management
Psychometric assessment and ethical testing practices
Complex adaptive systems in organizational contexts

title: About Me
text:
Education

Combined PhD/Masters of Organisational Psychology at Macquarie University (2022 to Present)
Bachelor of Psychology (Honours) & Bachelor of Commerce (Marketing Management Major) at Macquarie University (2016 to 2021)

title: Publications
text: Publications are listed in reverse chronological order. Please contact me for an e-copy of anything listed below if there is no option for post-print or open access.

title: Publications
text:
Conference Presentations

Coetzee, S., Crane, M. F., & Richardson, M. J. (2025). Modelling resilience in teams: A theoretical framework grounded in nonlinear dynamics. Poster presented at the 22nd Congress of the European Association of Work and Organizational Psychology, Prague, Czech Republic.
Coetzee, S., Crane, M. F., & Richardson, M. J. (2025). Connecting through communication: Extrinsic emotion regulation as a driver of team resilience. Oral presentation at the 22nd Congress of the European Association of Work and Organizational Psychology, Prague, Czech Republic.
Coetzee, S., Batia, J., Bucknell, K., & Crane, M. F. (2024). Harnessing team reflections for resilient outcomes: Insights from Dynamical Systems Theory. Symposium presented at the Australian Psychological Society College of Organisational Psychologists Conference, Perth, Australia.
Coetzee, S. (2024). A dynamical view of team resilience. Oral presentation at the Macquarie University Resilient Symposium, Sydney, Australia.

title: Publications
text:
Theses

Coetzee, S., (2021). Stress Mindset, Stress Appraisals, and Work Outcomes: A Multilevel Diary Study [Honours thesis, Macquarie University].


This page will be updated as new publications become available. For the most current information about my research or to discuss opportunities for collaboration, please see my LinkedIn profile or contact me directly via email.
